alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Greater Oconee; Greater Pickens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 1:42PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN FRANKLIN... SOUTHEASTERN STEPHENS...NORTHERN HART...WESTERN ANDERSON... SOUTHWESTERN PICKENS AND SOUTHEASTERN OCONEE COUNTIES THROUGH 215 PM EDT... At 142 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Walhalla to 11 miles east of Toccoa. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clemson, Seneca, Walhalla, Central, Pendleton, Westminster, Reed Creek, Gumlog, Avalon, and Tugaloo State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
